attributes.action: Include Aesthetic Impairment or "Ugliness" in The Equality Act 2010.
attributes.background: We call for “Aesthetic Impairment” to be added to The Equality Act (2010) by the UK government and for suffers to be awarded the same protection from discrimination as the other included groups.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people whom are aesthetically Impaired or “ugly” face discrimination and disadvantage on a daily basis. Many unattractive people can be left feeling ostracised and questioning their self-worth and it can also lead to the development of mental health issues. 

Whatever the nature or route cause of someone’s appearance, not everybody can conform with the image of what our society deems to be “attractive” and to judge someone based upon this is fundamentally wrong.

attributes.action: Stop stereotyping teenagers by making national citizen service compulsory
attributes.background: We are a group of teenagers who feel like we are stereotyped frequently, such as being followed in shops, being stopped and searched in groups, seen as criminals and thugs, this makes us feel on edge and ashamed to be called a teenager. We feel our aim will make society a better place, aged 16-18.
attributes.additional_details: Our research found that often terms used to describe teenagers were "hoodies, louts, heartless, evil, frightening, scum, monsters, inhumane and threatening."

attributes.action: Total life Ban if caught using hand held mobile phone
attributes.background: If caught using a hand held mobile phone for talking or texting you should be given a total life time ban from driving.

attributes.action: Repeal  the Health and Social Care Bill.
attributes.background: This bill has signed the death knell for the NHS as we knew it. It has allowed private companies to cherry pick via tender the most lucrative parts of the system. This can not be allowed to continue. The NHS should be there for all.

attributes.action: Government should not allow pilots to work on Christmas day
attributes.background:
This is a petition to bring to attention pilots who fly thousands of miles away from their families on the most precious day of the year for many people! 

Help me petition government to put a ban to flying on Christmas day!
attributes.additional_details:
I am surrounded by pilots, many of whom complain about working in Christmas day. The banks shut, so why shouldn't pilots have a "pilot day"? 

I call on government to help pilots and their families spend their day together. 

If pilots are being forced to fly on Christmas day, their families should be rewarded with free flights and accommodation to enable the families to be together. 

Please call on government to make this a possibility!

attributes.action: Make the 6 week holidays shorter by spreading the weeks throughout the year.
attributes.background: The 6 week holidays are far too long and children get sluggish at the start of the new term. School grades and attitudes towards school should improve as more time learning.

attributes.action: Small business should not pay employer's NI for employees of state pension age
attributes.background: Employees or Self-Employed of state pension age do not pay NI contributions so why should Employers? I spoke to David Cameron about this and he was intending to look into it but this did not happen due to the EU referendum result

attributes.action: Negotiate a bespoke reciprocal visa agreement between the UK and the EU
attributes.background: Now the UK voted to leave the EU we will lose the freedom of movement right. This will cease once we leave and will mean we have to apply for a visa to go to the EU on holiday as we are third country nationals. The EU has plans to introduce a £50 holiday visa for citizens of third countries.
attributes.additional_details: This £50 charge is quite expensive for a holiday visa and will deter people going abroad. The only option could be a reciprocal visa agreement between the UK and the EU/EEA. This could mean that UK citizens can travel to the EU, for 180 days, for free. This however, is only possible if we allow all EU nationals coming to the UK the same agreements. We could also include reciprocal emergency healthcare in this visa agreement. This will make it easier for full single market access.

attributes.action: Put 5 pence on national Insurance contributions to fund our N.H.S.
attributes.background: Everyone can afford 5pence to save our N.HS dont sit there do something

attributes.action: Introduce a TV License Discount for Full Time Students
attributes.background: This petition calls on the government to take advantage of the TV license freeze ending in March 2017 to introduce a reduced rate TV license for full time students living in single occupancy rooms. By introducing a reduced rate, more students would consider buying a license.
attributes.additional_details: Unlike a typical home where only one license is needed, students staying in halls of residence are required to purchase an individual license for their room. For example, if a hall has 8 rooms on it, each student is currently required to purchase their own license for just one room at full cost. This is a large amount of money and it is unfair to charge students so much more despite them being on limited budgets. By introducing a reduced rate for single rooms, more students would pay the fee.

attributes.action: Stop forcing English Standard on Young Deaf children
attributes.background: Make English more accessible for Deaf People (e.g. for us not to be forced to achieve English at C grade standard) each classes should have specialist tutor (e.g. Teacher of Deaf and being taught in small groups) Deaf people should not being stopped progressing from achieving a C grade or above
attributes.additional_details: English is our second language, as we find English so hard to understand! which is why we use Sign Language which has a different structure and no written language. We need to stop feeling like we are being forced to learn English at C grade Standard and it is important that we taught English in a way that is accessible to us.

attributes.action: Hold a general election under MMP
attributes.background: In the 2015 general election The conservative party got just 37 percent of the vote however they got a majority in the house of commons undermining the very ideas of democracy.
attributes.additional_details: The UK currently uses first pass the post which goes horribly with the UK's system of electing M.Ps creating a system which people can't vote for there preferred party and punishes those who do.MMP is a system that allows you to vote both for a local representative whilst allows you to vote for your favourable political party making it the best system for the country.if Britain claims to be a democracy it must act like one.

attributes.action: Establish extradition treaties so British victims of crime are supported.
attributes.background: I want to raise the issue of the safety of British Nationals and their families overseas and develop on the international extradition treaties and assistance that is in place.
attributes.additional_details: If you or a member of your family has been subjected to a crime a suspected criminal can flee to another country or back to the UK that has no treaty in place and will not face any criminal proceedings.

attributes.action: Parents have the right to fine a school, when teacher take time off
attributes.background: The Supreme Court ruled, child must in in school in term time. Then parents should have the right to fine schools, when teacher strike, take time off in term time and teacher training days in term time. If a child has to be at school, then the teacher should be.
attributes.additional_details:
Prime Minister Theresa May agreed it was for schools to decide on absences.
"It's right that the individual head teacher has that flexibility to make that decision," she said.

attributes.action: Legislate to reverse the Supreme Court school absence ruling
attributes.background: It is clear from  public outcry  that the vast majority, particularly those with school-aged children feel the High Court decision to be wrong and setting a very troubling precedent.  The government should  legislate to allow parents to take children out of school for up to 2 weeks per year

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for MPs to work at least 30 hours per week as an MP.
attributes.background: Taking account of the ultimate effect MPs have on everyone's lives the 'people' they represent have a right to know how much actual time each MP is actually spending on the job we expect and need them to do. As the ultimate elected officials they should display ultimate honesty and leadership.
attributes.additional_details:
In no other walk of life is it morally, legally, contractually or ethically acceptable to accept a job and then take on other roles which negatively affect or have the potential to negatively affect the position accepted. 

This is especially relevant to MPs who have the most important jobs in the country as they influence, effect and change laws/standards/bodies which directly and indirectly affect the lives of citizens in this country and beyond both today and for many many years to come.

attributes.action: Stop female hygiene products being called luxury items and end the "tampon tax"
attributes.background: Despite promises to remove the 5% VAT on sanitary products for women (the "tampon tax") in March 2016 it appears this still hain't happened. Throughout their lifetime the average woman spends £18450 on menstruation. £725 of this is tax. This is asking to end the VAT on all sanitary products.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.mirror.co.uk/money/costly-study-recently-claimed-tampons-6372419.amp
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/politics/12197451/David-Cameron-claims-victory-following-deal-with-EU-leaders-to-axe-tampon-tax.html (the last PM promised to remove the "tampon tax" buy failed to.)

attributes.action: Regulate & legalize MDMA. Drugs will always be taken, let's make it safer.
attributes.background: We know the safety profile for pure MDMA, yet due to it's illegal status, users of street MDMA run the risk of taking impure compounds that can be very dangerous and cause death. If MDMA is regulated we can be aware of dosage, frequency of consumption and have a pure drug not supplied by criminals.

attributes.action: Allow freedom to camp on any non domestic land in England.
attributes.background: I wish for a law that allows access to open land for the benefit of ordinary citizens to camp overnight for recreation purposes without fear of prosecution by the land owner. Similar to the freedom to roam act but with the addition to camp out for the night.
attributes.additional_details: I/we believe the enjoyment of the countryside will appeal to our children, tourists and fellow citizens and  enhanced by decriminalising open camping on rural land.

attributes.action: Agency work should not be eligible for a work visa following brexit
attributes.background: Following the uk leaving the Eu..... as agency work is not full time employment then to stop the British worker being at a disadvantage then work visas should not be issued for this kind of work as there is no guarantee of employment

attributes.action: Sex-Ed to include infertility and reproductive conditions on National Curriculum
attributes.background:
Sex education should not just be about sex, STI's and pregnancy.
Our children should be aware of signs of infertility and other conditions, how to seek help and deal with them.
These conditions can affect children of any age, and we need to give them as much knowledge and support on that journey.
attributes.additional_details: PCOS alone affects 1/10 women world wide and can be recognised through the pubescent stage. Yet schools are not teaching children things they should be noticing in their body - How to spot early menopause? Erectile dysfunction? PCOS? Any other conditions? Children are taught every day about sexting, safe sex, and staying safe online. What about what is happening to their bodies biologically? This information is just as important to keep children safe and healthy, not only now but into adulthood.

attributes.action: Draft a law requiring employers to pay workers equal wages for equal work
attributes.background: Too many employers are abusing the ignorance of employees and their own positions in power by paying different employees different wages for the exact same work. This practise is not fair and must be stopped with more pay being given only to those who take on more responsibilities in the work place

attributes.action: Make speaking to the claimee's doctor a compulsory part of the PIP interview
attributes.background: During a PIP interview the claimant's Dr should be called to ensure the interview process is fair and all the medical evidence is correct.

attributes.action: Urge Brazil not to hand the Amazon over to mining companies
attributes.background: Brazilian President Michel Temer is approving several new infrastructure projects including dams, man-made waterways and mines which will exacerbate the deforestation of the Amazon rainforest. More than 40 hydroelectric dams will be built by 2020, which will endanger about one-fifth of the Amazon.
attributes.additional_details:
https://news.vice.com/story/brazil-is-handing-over-the-amazon-rainforest-to-mining-companies-and-big-agriculture

The UK Government should work with other countries to put pressure on Brazil to stop this.

attributes.action: reinstate banishment on the statute book
attributes.background: with so many criminals and terrorists being home grown reinstate banishment as a punishment so we can expel these people who are a danger to society.

attributes.action: Force internet providers by law to block terrorist propaganda
attributes.background: Terrorist attacks are happening around the world carried out by people radicalised by online terrorist propaganda. The solution? Stop the internet from being used as a platform for terrorists to brainwash people by forcing internet providers, by law, to block this kind of material from public view.

attributes.action: DFID should Stop its aid to Tanzania
attributes.background: We are taxpayers should expect our money to be used in an ethical way. When there are clear breaches of political rights or human rights we expect a response in terms of the aid we contribute. The fact that the US has reacted in such a strong way gives a very good signal.

attributes.action:
Essex County Hospital, Colchester, Essex. 
(Reverse the decision to close it).
attributes.background:
Nonsensical decision to close this well used and much loved facility:

We are asking for a petition to reverse the decision and keep it open:

To include extending it's facilities and increasing it's use as an emergency overspill hospital.

attributes.action: Reform apprenticeships to only cover skilled trades/labor.
attributes.background:
Appreciateships are supposed to be a training system in which to teach new practicioners a trade proffession with the aim of becoming a licensed professional/journeyman in a trade

Companies are abusing the fact that apprentices get paid below the NMW to recieve cheap labor for unskilled jobs
attributes.additional_details:
This petition was inspired by the story of the subway "sandwich artist" apprenticeship yet there are many more examples in my own local area of abuses of the system.
 Retail apprenticeships waiter/waitress apprenticeships fish and chip shop apprenticeships are all local examples I have found which are an abuse of unskilled labor to pay less than minimum wage and offer no real professional skills to progress a future career past minimum wage.

attributes.action: Give people who have to re sit maths GCSE after getting a D multiple times a C.
attributes.background: People keep having to re do maths years after school and keep getting a D in there exams time after time. Maths GCSE isn't for everyone and they are getting harder every year. I think determined students who have re done maths GCSE over three times should be given an equivalent qualification.
attributes.additional_details: I am a business student who has re sat maths three times and keep missing out my just a few marks. There are many students in the same situation.

attributes.action: Compulsory purchase land and  start   to build houses for  first time buyers
attributes.background: More  needs to be done to build houses for the young  and growing families,  . housing costs are at record levels  Mortgages  are in some cases 8 times earnings , rents  in some areas un- affordable . mortgages are now  reaching into peoples  very old age and everyday house prices are increasing
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/money/mortgageshome/article-4270996/Home-ownership-moving-reach-warns-David-Miles.html

attributes.action: Assistance to be provided to visa applicants to go back home in an emergency
attributes.background: Home office is unable to make decision in time on application  even which are point based and the delay is too much and because of this if an emergency situation arises in the applicant s' country especially death there is no way they can attend the death ceremony of their beloved parents
attributes.additional_details: There are so many cases that have passed the stipulated time home office even does not bother to reply to letters from applicant This country which claims to be supporter of humanitarian issue one organization is creating humanitarian problem for applicant back home.

attributes.action: Life sentences for rape. First, second or third degree!
attributes.background: If a man sexual assaults a woman forcibly, or when the victim is uncapable to consent they must serve a full life sentence in jail.
attributes.additional_details: Too many boys/men are getting away with "sex without consent" this needs to be stopped. If there is a bigger punishment less boys/men will scar women and use them as objects to sexually assault. Third degree rape is just as bad as first or second degree rape.

attributes.action: Hold a Snap General Election on 4th May 2017
attributes.background: The Government would be able to negotiate Brexit with a stronger mandate if they had a larger majority in Parliament. It would also make getting future bills passed easier.

attributes.action: Nationalise Social care in the UK
attributes.background: It has been widely reported that several privatised care homes have pulled out of public sector contracts as "We didn't think we could do it for the money - it was as simple as that." and it "doesn't leave a great deal" (of profit). For too long people have paid thousands for substandard care.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to do mass balloon releases for special events of any kind.
attributes.background: Balloons and plastics are a massive problem for wildlife. A big part of the problem is litter, but also things like mass balloon releases. While it's fun at a wedding or party or some idea of sending a wish for a lost loved one it's not worth putting animals in danger for.
attributes.additional_details: Check out the marine conservation website or Google the effects of plastics in our oceans.

attributes.action: Stop culling deers at Richmond park, neuter instead to control the population
attributes.background: The deers at Richmond are a key attraction at the park. There is no need to cull these innocent deers, neutering part of the herd is a more humane option to managing the population.

attributes.action: Make it so fluoride levels are clearly stated on all packaging through the UK
attributes.background: Toxic warnings are stated on most forms of packaging I.e cigerettes, alcohol & food so why is fluoride not?? It's a huge risk factor to our health ,many of us would like to manage our intake of fluoride. We ask that the levels are clearly stated on our food, drink & toothpastes
attributes.additional_details:
Research has suggested high levels of fluoride can not only effect our health as adults, it's having a major impact on our children. High levels of fluoride can be fatal, just like cigerettes, alcohol and sugars.   
2 examples of studies below..

http://www.foodandourhealth.com/bottled-water-filled-fluoride-heres-complete-list-brands-avoid/

http://fluoridealert.org/content/top_ten/

attributes.action: Allow citizens over the age of ten to vote.
attributes.background: Children have an open mind and this will introduce them to democracy. I believe that children should be able to vote because I want the United Kingdom to be a true democracy.

attributes.action: Car insurance companies must renew policies at most competitive rate
attributes.background: Car insurance companies are profiteering from British drivers by increasing annual renewal premiums far above those offered to new customers. Only those savvy enough, and who have the time and ability to challenge the increases or search for another deal, escape these unfair penalties.
attributes.additional_details:
Drivers who fail to challenge the increased premiums are being charged as much as £40 more for the same policy than if they were a new customer.
With over 35 million vehicles licensed in the UK (DVLA; 2013), if each driver fails to challenge their increased premium, insurers could be tricking the public out of as much as £1.4 billion a year.
Drivers shouldn't be forced to search for the most competitive deal every year. This sneaky practice of overcharging existing customers should be illegal.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory that all smartphone apps show who is tracking our activity.
attributes.background: In the wake of the CIA found as intentionally tracking citizens activity through smart phones and TVs, I propose that as UK citizens, we have the right to know as and when; who is tracking our smartphone activity regardless of the organisation involved.

attributes.action: Make car ownership fairer by introducing a pay-per-mile car tax
attributes.background: The Government charges drivers a fixed amount of car tax no matter how much they use their cars. We urge Transport Secretary Chris Grayling to adopt a fairer Vehicle Excise Duty by charging motorists based on miles driven. Car tax can be paid during an MOT, with bills calculated from actual mileage.
attributes.additional_details:
http://blog.justmiles.co.uk/would-car-tax-be-fairer-if-we-paid-it-by-the-mile/

Independent reports suggest need for radical reforms to car tax: http://bit.ly/2mKvxXR

60% of motorists would prefer pay-per-mile car tax and over 50% would drive less: http://bit.ly/2ntKEEM

A trial of pay-per-mile tax in the USA found the distributional effects of a per mile flat vehicle tax fee did not place a significantly greater burden on either lower income or rural populations: http://bit.ly/2n1s614

attributes.action: Legal requirement employer must give employees payslip min a day before pay day
attributes.background:
Wages wrong on payday this can cause financial troubles.
Giving your payslip on payday gives you no time to plan corrective action. This may effect your credit score. When bills do not get paid etc. Especially when in some cases its the employer at fault not the employee but employee gets penalized

attributes.action: Ban the sale of energy and high caffeine beverages and foods to anyone under 16
attributes.background: Energy drinks and energy bars are all too available in shops to youngsters these days with potentially fatal consequences! Let's protect our children. Let's ban the sale of these products to those under 16!

attributes.action: Motorway 50mph zones change to 70mph when no workers are present
attributes.background: Most long journeys spent on UK motorways you come across 50MPH zones which rarely have workers on it. Why not make the 50MPH limit redundant when workers aren't present and put the speed limit back to 70MPH.
attributes.additional_details: Driving regularly on the M1 , I notice that there is rarely workers on the Motorway 50MPH zone that stretches for 15 miles. In order to speed up journeys and avoid congestion, put the speed limit back to 70mph when there is no workers there. This will help speed up journeys and eliminate frustration for drivers as they are stuck driving at 50MPH on the UK motorways with no reason.

attributes.action: Lower the minimum age for opening a Help to Buy ISA.
attributes.background: It is increasingly difficult for the next generation to get onto the property ladder. It takes longer to save up for inflating deposits, so young people should be allowed to start incentivised savings sooner, and parents/grandparents allowed to gift into Help To Buy ISAs well before a person is 16.

attributes.action: Lorries to have their own lane on the motorway with a barrier
attributes.background: I got hit by a lorry cause the driver was falling asleep, now this will effect my insurance. Also many people are dying cause of lorries doing the same.

attributes.action: Where a treatment exists, provide fair and fast access for rare disease patients
attributes.background: People with rare diseases wait on average over 2 years for potentially life-changing treatments. Less than half of treatments approved in the last 15 years are funded by NHS England vs. 93% in Germany and 81% in France. If a treatment exists, access should be the same as for more common conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
The Department of Health, NICE and NHS England should work together with patient groups, clinical experts, and the Pharmaceutical Industry to establish a new and fair process for appraisal of rare disease medicines.

Data from the Report:
Equity and Access: Making the UK a Rare Disease Leader. (2017) Initiated and funded by Shire Pharmaceuticals and developed in collaboration with an external steering group

This petition, and the Equity and Access Report, were initiated and funded by Shire.

attributes.action: Increase the budget for the social care and the pension fund
attributes.background: Social Care and the Pension fund are some of the most undersupported yet most important parts of the budget. Businesses such as BHS that had a massive hole in their pension should not be allowed to fail their workers in this way.
attributes.additional_details: Many aspects of Social Care are criticised for being understaffed or poorly managed however with the budget the way it is they can not do anything to get this changed.

attributes.action: Make proper funding of existing schools the priority in this budget.
attributes.background: Existing schools in the UK are facing severe cuts to their budgets due to a number of policies that create additional costs or loss of income.  The government has failed to acknowledge this deficit, and schools are now facing extreme decisions, including: closures and staffing reductions.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/education/2017/mar/07/headteachers-write-to-parents-over-school-funding-and-job-cuts
Several recent policies are creating this deficit.  Schools must comply but have not been offered any funding to make this possible.   It affects all schools, even those who have been rated outstanding by OFSTED.   
Real spending on existing schools is falling by 6.5%.  https://www.theguardian.com/education/2017/feb/27/schools-to-be-hit-with-first-real-time-funding-cuts-in-20-years
